items.title: Pro-Palestinian protester causes crash in Vuelta
items.summary: A pro-Palestinian protester causes a minor crash with 56km left on stage 15 of the Vuelta a Espana - which Mads Pedersen wins with fellow Dane Jonas Vingegaard still the overall leader.

items.title: New Zealand top Pool C after big win over Ireland
items.summary: Braxton Sorensen-McGee scores a hat-trick of tries as world champions New Zealand beat Ireland 40-0 and secure top spot in Pool C of the Women's Rugby World Cup.

items.title: Pregnant Canter wins Burghley Horse Trials
items.summary: Ros Canter wins a second successive Burghley Horse Trials on Lordships Graffalo, weeks after announcing she was expecting her second child.

items.title: South Africa fall to 24-6 as Archer dominates
items.summary: England make a sensational start with the ball as South Africa fall to 24-6 in their chase of 415 runs in the third One Day International in Southampton.

items.title: Ruthless New Zealand top Pool C with Ireland win
items.summary: Teenage wing Braxton Sorensen-McGee scores a hat-trick of tries as reigning world champions New Zealand showed their class to beat Ireland 40-0 and secure top spot in Pool C.

items.title: 'Hungry' Vignola's dream debut shows Everton potential
items.summary: An "exceptional performance" is the perfect way for Ornella Vignola to announce herself on the Women's Super League stage.

items.title: Salford second-row Waine released from hospital
items.summary: Salford second-row Emmanuel Waine is released from hospital three days after being knocked unconscious during their Super League loss to Catalans.

items.title: AMD lists mystery Radeon 9060 XL model in ROCm documents, but it is more likely to be a typo than a new SKU
items.summary: AMD's ROCm 6.4.2 software stack lists a non-existent Radeon RX 9060 XL GPU, likely a typo confusing internal 'Navi 44 XL' die naming with official product branding. But who knows?

items.title: Sabalenka retains US Open to win first Grand Slam of 2025
items.summary: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka beats American Amanda Anisimova 6-3 7-6 (7-3) to retain the US Open and win her first Grand Slam of 2025, having already lost the Australian and French Open finals earlier this year.

items.title: Twelve-try Italy beat Brazil to end World Cup with win
items.summary: Italy score 12 tries to beat Brazil 64-3 and finish the 2025 Women's Rugby World Cup with a bonus-point win.

items.title: Celtic's transfer 'PR disaster' is 'defending indefensible' - pundits & fans have say
items.summary: Celtic's attempts to explain their transfer window business are described as "a PR disaster" and an attempt to "defend the indefensible".
